thread.title: Trump will hold Orlando rally Saturday after crisis week
thread.title_full: Trump will hold Orlando rally Saturday after crisis week | Daily Mail Online

author: Geoff Earle, Deputy U.s. Political Editor For Dailymail.com
title: Trump will hold Orlando rally Saturday after crisis week
text:
President Trump is getting away from the controversies that have engulfed his new administration, with a campaign-style rally planned near Orlando Saturday.
Trump tweeted about the event Wednesday afternoon, as political Washington tracked the fallout from the stunning resignation of his national security advisor, Mike Flynn, and reports of extensive contacts between his campaign team and the Russians .
'Join me in Florida this Saturday at 5pm for a rally at the Orlando-Melbourne International Airport!' Trump wrote.
The Orlando Sentinel reported that White House officials told Brevard County officials that Trump would stop at the airport en route to Mar-a-Lago in West Palm Beach.
White House press secretary Sean Spicer told reporters who asked about it to contact the campaign since he said it was a 'campaign' event.
President Donald Trump, seen here campaigning in Orlando in 2016
It would be the third weekend at row for Trump at Mar-a-Lago. Last week, he brought Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe there – though he was dogged by the Russia scandal when reporters asked him aboard Air Force One about new revelations about Flynn.
He also came under fire for grappling with an emerging North Korea missile launch over dinner at his club, where other dues-paying members shot photographs as his team appeared to take in new information at an al fresco meal occasionally illuminated by cell phones.
Trump has apparently been itching to get out of Washington. The White House scrubbed a planned to the Harley-Davidson factory in Milwaukee after concern it would be disrupted by protesters angered by his immigration order, the Milwaukee Journal-Sentinel reported.
He also scrubbed a trip to Ohio. The Florida airport rally, scheduled for 5 pm, should still get him to the luxury Mar-a-Lago club by dinner time.
First Lady Melania Trump has accompanied him there the past two trips.
Trump tweeted about the rally on Wednesday, with political D.C. still obsessed with the unfolding Russia scandal
ON THE ROAD AGAIN: Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump campaigns at the Central Florida Fairgrounds
ALL I WANT FOR CHRISTMAS IS ... President Elect Donald Trump speaking to the crowd during his Thank You Tour in Orlando
GET ME OUT OF HERE: President Donald Trump meets with retail industry leaders in the Roosevelt Room of the White House in Washington
National Security Adviser Michael Flynn resigned his post on the 24th day of the Trump administration
President Donald Trump (R) and Israel Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu (L) shake hands during a joint news conference where Trump decried leaks
Trump has continued to vent about the media, spies, and Democrats after the drama of Flynn's departure after a chaotic first 25 days have rocked Washington.
On Wednesday, a day after the White House said Trump had asked Flynn to leave over an erosion of confidence in him, Trump went after 'criminal' leakers who dished dirt on Flynn.
Trump Flynn was torpedoed by Democratic partisans who 'illegally leaked' intelligence material in order to harm him.
Appearing in a joint press conference with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, Trump said 'the fake media' had fomented a scandal that wouldn't exist but for angry Democrats who were acting out in the wake of an embarrassing loss in November's presidential election.
'General Flynn is a wonderful man,' Trump said. 'I think he's been treated very, very unfairly by the media – as I call it, the fake media, in many cases.'
'From intelligence, papers are being leaked, things are being leaked,' Trump complained. 'It's a criminal action – a criminal act. And it's been going on for a long time, before me, but now it's really going on.'
A California appeals court temporarily struck down his immigration ban. And on Wednesday, his labor secretary nominee, Andrew Puzder, had his nomination withdrawn under pressure from Republicans who were put off by Puzder having hired an illegal housekeeper. A 1990 video tape from the Oprah Winfrey showed with Puzder's ex-wife accusing him of domestic violence. She has since recanted the charge.
